title.narrative: Study ICT-support to emigrants business ventures

description.narrative: Projektet innebär att genomföra en studie som tar fram lämpligt innehåll och teknik för en ICT-plattform (Diaspora Link). Plattformen skall fungera som en länk mellan entreprenörer i hemlandet och i diasporan. Studien genomförs av Stockholms Universitet/DSV-institutionen. Intentionen är att i studien utveckla en ICT-plattform för migrationskorridoren mellan Sverige och

This project concerns a study on content and technology for an ICT-platform "Diaspora Link" a "Network for Transnational Diaspora Entrepreneurship as a Development Link between Home and Residence Countries. The study is made by Stockholm university/DSV. The intention is to develop the ICT-platform for the migration corridor Ethiopia/Sweden.

participating-org.narrative: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

description.narrative: Övergripande fråga: Resultat kopplat till avsedd effekt 2014Fråga: Sammanfatta resultat relaterade till avsedd effekt (denna information kommer att skickas till Open Aid).Svar: (Av Peter Erichs) Projektet omfattar genomförandet av en studie rubricerad "A study of an ICT-platform supporting diaspora entrepreneurship and enterprising targeting the countries of origin". De övergripande målen är: 1. A survey of the entreprenurial temperature (innovation system) in the corridor Ethiopia/Sweden delivered buy the expert team and collaborating organizations specified below. 2.Specification based on above survey of an ICT-platform and demonstration of a prototype together with partners involved. 3. A business and implementation plan. 1. A detailed study of the entreprenurial temperature (innovation system) is reported under the heading " Content and Marketing of an ICT-platform supporting diaspora entreprenurship and enterprising targeting the countries of origin". Especially appendices 2 and 4 as well as Managers´s summary. 2. The ICT-prototype and demonstration of a prototype with partner involved has been reported in the final report under the heading "Entrepreneurship in Ethiopian Diaspora: Technology Domain". IBMs Corporate Social Responsibility program helped to solve the issue of developing a protoype tjhat meets requirements of the project. Opportunities and challenges with the prototype have been successfully identifiedand evaluated by the targetsgroups. Evaluations have, according to report, demonstrated that the prototype met the requirements for the four services, requested in the research application, 1. A meeting place for partners and stakeholders, 2. A learning and tuition e-platform, 3. A resource databank and 4 A set of information and transaction services related to finances, administration and legislation. 3. The business and implemetation plan has primarily been dealt with and elaborated on in the content domain of the project acivities and is reported under the heading "Content and Marketing of an ICT-platform supporting diaspora entrepreneurship and enterprising targeting the countries of origin", among others in the variety of appendices entitled: Report from visit to Ethiopia, January 8-20 2013, Concept Note Vaule Chain Partnership EWEA, Diaspora Link&DFID/PEPE, Washington report Review of the market Potential in the Ethiopia/Sweden corridor Diaspora Link International Symposium on Transnational Diaspora Entrepreneurship Invitastion to constituting meeting for formation of Swedish Ethiopian Chamber of Commerce, SECCC as a voluntary association in Sweden. The technology domain has contributed to the business plan with a business model for a cloud-based solution.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
